page.title: 09HOUSING
page.content: Rhewl village houses some 200 people in all.Some 60% live on the Council Estate built in the '50's; the rest in private dwellings.The Post Office includes the only shop.No other amenities exist to date besides recreational ones.Llanynys hamlet houses some 120 without amenity. Housing conditions are good- older properties having been improved, often with Council Grant aid.Many of the once humble rural cottages have been modernised,and command prices beyond the reach of most local people, who are left with the choice of waiting for a council house to become vacant or moving to Town.Some of the larger farms have tied cottages for their employees.The occasional cottage is a second home,thus contributing very little to the community.
